common.usage: To use the {{component}} component, simply import it into your React file (fr):

button.title: Button (fr)
button.subtitle: The Button component is a flexible and customizable button implementation for React applications. It supports various properties for styling, behavior, and functionality, making it suitable for different use cases. (fr)

checkboxInput.title: CheckboxInput (fr)
checkboxInput.subtitle: The CheckboxInput component is a versatile and reusable component that supports both single and multiple checkbox selections. It allows for customization through a variety of props and handles validation, error messages, and helper texts. (fr)

usage.customLabel: Custom label for single checkbox input (fr)
usage.customOptionsLabel: Custom label for multiple checkbox input (fr)
usage.customOptionsLabelDescription: The `renderOptionsLabel` function in a checkbox group allows custom rendering of options label. You can use it to display rich content like icons, descriptions, or formatted text. (fr)

confirmationModal.title: Confirmation modal (fr)
confirmationModal.message: Are you sure you want to proceed? (fr)

data.title: Data (fr)
data.subtitle: The Data component is a reusable React component designed to display a labeled value. (fr)

usage.hiddenDropdownIcon: Hidden dropdown icon with default label (fr)

basic.title: Basic (fr)
basic.description: Editable title can be used by passing a `title` property. Title level is optional, it is `h1` by default. `onblur` event on the title input field triggers `onUpdate` method. (fr)

controlled.title: Controlled (fr)
controlled.description: Editable title can be used as a controllable element by passing `onChange` property. Note this will impact the performance of the component. (fr)

disabled.description: The edit function can be disabled. To do this, pass the `allowEdit` option with value `false`. (fr)
disabled.title: Disabled edit (fr)

customToggler.description: The toggle button can be customized by pass your own toggler using `toggler` prop. (fr)
customToggler.title: Custom toggler (fr)

editableTitle.subtitle: Editable title is an extension to a page or section title which can be edited. (fr)
editableTitle.title: Editable title (fr)

messages.addHorizontal: Add following css to your stylesheet for horizontal borders (fr)
messages.addVertical: Add following css to your stylesheet for vertical borders (fr)

usage.builtInActionColumn: Table demonstrating built in actions column use case (fr)
usage.customCellDataFormatting: Table with custom cell data formatter (fr)
usage.withCustomFilter: Table with custom filter component and filterFn (fr)
usage.customStaticFilter: Table with custom  filter component and static filterFn (fr)
usage.rowSpecificActions: Table with actions menu items filtered based on row data logic (fr)
usage.tableBorderHorizontal: Table with custom style for horizontal border (fr)
usage.tableBorderVertical: Table with custom style for vertical border (fr)

contents.content1: Season sale: Up to 50% off selected items! (fr)
contents.content2: New features just launched! Check them out! (fr)
contents.content3: New Year, New You: Start fresh with our services! (fr)
contents.content4: We value your feedback: take our quick survey! (fr)
contents.content5: Warning: Limited time only! Sale ends soon! (fr)

message.subtitle: The Message component displays contextual messages with optional icons and a closable action. It supports custom slots, making it flexible for various use cases. (fr)
message.title: Message (fr)

modal.title: Modal (fr)

disableTabState.subTitle: By default, tab state is persisted between page refresh and navigations. You can disable this feature by passing persistState={false} prop to the component (fr)
disableTabState.title: State persistence disabled (fr)

disableTabState.subTitle: By default, tab state is persisted between page refresh and navigations. You can disable this feature by passing persistState={false} prop to the component (fr)
disableTabState.title: State persistence disabled (fr)

select.autoSortOptionsInfo: By default, options are sorted alphabetically. To render options in original order as provided, you can use autoSortOptions={false} (fr)
select.label: Country (fr)
select.title: Select (fr)

switchInput.title: Switch input (fr)
switchInput.subtitle: The SwitchInput component is a customizable checkbox switch for toggling states. It supports additional properties such as error handling and labeling. (fr)
